result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan Bradley Gutzdorf was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
--On Count #1 pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443  

--To pay total amount to be paid in $30 per month installments commencing on 7/1/15 and on the 1st day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a 17  day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive

to serve 60 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence on   4/5/15 at 5:00 pm

  Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

FINANCIAL: Bkpg. Screen Print
Time to Pay/ Payment Extension Reminder
Criminal case settlement
Huber/work release notification
Reminder of payment extension

Case called at 10:24am [mo]
Defendant Ryan Bradley Gutzdorf in court. ADA Monica J. Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Right to Counsel given; Mr. Gutzdorf waives right to Counsel. 
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance 

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of "No Contest" entered on Count #1 & Count #2; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses: Count #3
ADA Hall submits Victim Impact Statement
Sentencing arguments given by ADA Hall
Statement made by Mr. Gutzdorf
The Court has colloquy with Mr. Gutzdorf regarding empoyments and work hours. 
The Court sentences Defendant to:
--On Count #1 to serve 60 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to commence on   4/5/15 at 5:00 pm
--On Count #2 to serve 60 days in Jefferson County Jail, with Huber privileges; to be served consecutive to sentence on Count #1 
--0 days credit for time already served given
--On Count #1 pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443  
--On Count #2 pay costs of $243 plus $200 DNA surcharge= $443  
--To pay total amount to be paid in $30 per month installments commencing on 7/1/15 and on the 1st day of each month thereafter until paid in full; non-payment shall result in a 17  day jail term with Huber privileges, consecutive
recess:10:54am
Status conference on March 31, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 18, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Copy of Criminal Complaint
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at 10:25 am [Clerk SH]
[Commissioner Mark Fremgen presiding for BrII]
Defendant Ryan Bradley Gutzdorf in court. ADA John E K Fryatt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Service of Complaint admitted; charge/penalties recited; reading waived.
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Mr. Gutzdorf indicates that he would like to proceed today without counsel
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant; Court finds waiver is knowingly & voluntarily made

Court continues $500 cash bond, already posted, with conditions: 
-No contact with Ashley Gutzdorf except through 3rd party for child placement & visitation
Recess: 10:32 am 

NEXT: (1) Schedule DA PTC on 3/18/15 at 9:00 am - Send notices (2) Schedule STC on 3/31/15 at 10:00 am  - Send notices
* FINANCIAL RECORDS *
